text_01: Keep your tone of voice positive and friendly and speak slightly more slowly. Your rate of speech can help the patient to understand and communicate.
text_02: Keep to one conversation subject at a time and reduce the amount of information you are trying to give.
text_03: Use easy to understand language, keep requests or instructions as simple as possible and do your best to minimise choice.
text_04: Do not interrupt the patient or presume their answers by filling any silences. Interruption can cause a loss of thought and can discourage communication.
